info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 3:47PM CDT until June 21 at 9:38AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Neosho River at Iola affecting Allen County.
Neosho River near Chanute affecting Allen and Neosho Counties.
Arkansas River at Oxford affecting Sumner County.
Arkansas River at Arkansas City affecting Cowley County.
Neosho River near Erie affecting Neosho County.
Neosho River near Parsons affecting Labette and Neosho Counties.
Neosho River at Oswego affecting Labette and Cherokee Counties.
Cow Creek near Hutchinson affecting Reno and Rice Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Neosho River near Erie.
* WHEN...From Wednesday evening to late Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, The road 7 miles northwest of Erie at 190th Road just west of Big Creek becomes flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 33.0 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING
